alert.note: Alert for Kingman; Reno; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 5:09AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Reno, western Sedgwick and northern Kingman Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 509 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Turon, or 10 miles northwest of Kingman, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingman, Cheney, Haven, Garden Plain, Mount Hope, Pretty Prairie, Arlington, Cunningham, Turon, Murdock, Waterloo, Langdon, Penalosa, Cheney Lake, Mt Vernon, Kingman Airport, Lake Afton and Cheney State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
